Package org.neo4j.io.pagecache

Interface PagedFile

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AccessCheckingPagedFile, AdversarialPagedFile, DatabasePageCache.DatabasePageFile, DelegatingPagedFile, MuninnPagedFile, StubPagedFile
    public interface PagedFile
extends AutoCloseable
    The representation of a file that has been mapped into the associated page cache.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int PF_EAGER_FLUSH
      Flush pages more aggressively, after they have been dirtied by a write cursor.

      Do not load in the page if it is not loaded already.

      Disallow pinning and navigating to pages outside the range of the underlying file.

      Read-ahead hint for sequential scanning.

      Pin the pages with a shared lock.
      static int PF_SHARED_WRITE_LOCK
      Pin the pages with a shared write lock.
      static int PF_TRANSIENT
      Do not update page access statistics.

    • Field Detail

      • PF_SHARED_READ_LOCK

        static final int PF_SHARED_READ_LOCK
        Pin the pages with a shared lock.

        This implies PF_NO_GROW, since pages under read locks cannot be safely written to anyway, so there's no point in trying to go beyond the end of the file.

        This cannot be combined with PF_SHARED_WRITE_LOCK.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PF_SHARED_WRITE_LOCK

        static final int PF_SHARED_WRITE_LOCK
        Pin the pages with a shared write lock.

        This will mark the pages as dirty, and caused them to be flushed, if they are evicted.

        Note that write locks are not exclusive. You must use other means to coordinate access to the data on the pages. The write lock only means that the page will not be concurrently evicted.

        Note also that write locks exclude eviction. So since we can assume that write locks never make conflicting modifications (higher level locks should ensure this), it is safe to perform page writes without a shouldRetry loop. The shouldRetry method on write locking cursors always returns false.

        This cannot be combined with PF_SHARED_READ_LOCK.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PF_NO_GROW

        static final int PF_NO_GROW
        Disallow pinning and navigating to pages outside the range of the underlying file.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PF_READ_AHEAD

        static final int PF_READ_AHEAD
        Read-ahead hint for sequential scanning.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PF_NO_FAULT

        static final int PF_NO_FAULT
        Do not load in the page if it is not loaded already. The methods PageCursor.next() and PageCursor.next(long) will always return true for pages that are within the range of the file, but the PageCursor.getCurrentPageId() will return PageCursor.UNBOUND_PAGE_ID for pages that are not in-memory. The current page id must be checked on every PageCursor.shouldRetry() loop iteration, in case it (for a read cursor) was evicted concurrently with the page access.

        PF_NO_FAULT implies PF_NO_GROW, since a page fault is necessary to be able to extend a file.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PF_TRANSIENT

        static final int PF_TRANSIENT
        Do not update page access statistics.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PF_EAGER_FLUSH

        static final int PF_EAGER_FLUSH
        Flush pages more aggressively, after they have been dirtied by a write cursor.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • io

        PageCursor io​(long pageId,
              int pf_flags,
              PageCursorTracer tracer)
       throws IOException
        Initiate an IO interaction with the contents of the paged file.

        The basic structure of an interaction looks like this: 

        
     try ( PageCursor cursor = pagedFile.io( startingPageId, intentFlags ) )
     {
         if ( cursor.next() )
         {
             do
             {
                 // perform read or write operations on the page
             }
             while ( cursor.shouldRetry() );
         }
     }
        PageCursors are AutoCloseable, so interacting with them using try-with-resources is recommended.

        The returned PageCursor is initially not bound, so next must be called on it before it can be used.

        The first next call will advance the cursor to the initial page, as given by the pageId parameter. Until then, the cursor won't be bound to any page, the PageCursor.getCurrentPageId() method will return the PageCursor.UNBOUND_PAGE_ID constant, and attempts at reading from or writing to the cursor will throw a NullPointerException.

        After the next call, if it returns true, the cursor will be bound to a page, and the get and put methods will access that page.

        After a call to PageCursor.rewind(), the cursor will return to its initial state.

        The pf_flags argument expresses the intent of the IO operation. It is a bitmap that combines various PF_* constants. You must always specify your desired locking behaviour, with either PF_SHARED_WRITE_LOCK or PF_SHARED_READ_LOCK.

        The two locking modes cannot be combined, but other intents can be combined with them. For instance, if you want to write to a page, but also make sure that you don't write beyond the end of the file, then you can express your intent with PF_SHARED_WRITE_LOCK | PF_NO_GROW â€“ note how the flags are combined with a bitwise-OR operator. Arithmetic addition can also be used, but might not make it as clear that we are dealing with a bit-set.

        Parameters:
        pageId - The initial file-page-id, that the cursor will be bound to after the first call to next.
        pf_flags - A bitmap of PF_* constants composed with the bitwise-OR operator, that expresses the desired locking behaviour, and other hints.
        tracer - underlying page cursor tracer
        Returns:
        A PageCursor in its initial unbound state. Never null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there was an error accessing the underlying file.

        void flushAndForce()
            throws IOException
        Flush all dirty pages into the file channel, and force the file channel to disk.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • flushAndForce

        void flushAndForce​(IOLimiter limiter)
            throws IOException
        Flush all dirty pages into the file channel, and force the file channel to disk, but limit the rate of IO as advised by the given IOPSLimiter.
        Parameters:
        limiter - The IOLimiter that determines if pauses or sleeps should be injected into the flushing process to keep the IO rate down.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getLastPageId

        long getLastPageId()
            throws IOException
        Get the file-page-id of the last page in the file.

        This will return a negative number (not necessarily -1) if the file is completely empty.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this file has been unmapped
        IOException

      • close

        void close()
        Release a handle to a paged file.

        If this is the last handle to the file, it will be flushed and closed.

        Note that this operation assumes that there are no write page cursors open on the paged file. If there are, then their writes may be lost, as they might miss the last flush that can happen on their data.

        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        See Also:
        AutoCloseable.close()

      • setDeleteOnClose

        void setDeleteOnClose​(boolean deleteOnClose)
        Set if this page file can be deleted on close. Pages of marked for deletion file do not need to be flushed on close so closing file that is marked for deletion can be significantly faster.
        Parameters:
        deleteOnClose - true if file can be deleted on close, false otherwise.

      • isDeleteOnClose

        boolean isDeleteOnClose()
        Check if this can be deleted on close.
        Returns:
        true if file can be deleted on close, false otherwise.

      • getDatabaseName

        Optional<String> getDatabaseName()
        An optional name of the database the mapped file belongs to. This option associates the mapped file with a database.
